creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: quiet river with reeds at LR and dock-like structure with tall poles and fishing gear (?) in center; in background, a flat landscape with two buildings nestled among trees; dense trees in background, reflecting on water in foreground; dusk or twilight
inscription: left: 自摺　昭和拾年作　吉川 {jizuri, Shōwa jūnen saku, Yoshikawa} | bottom, printed: Yoshikawa | in pencil: Hiroshi Yoshida
markings: LRC, red artist\'s seal A: 博 {Hiroshi}
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
title: Yoshikawa
